rev.comment: The reference to necrophiliacs working in the funeral business seems unfounded, so I've removed the sentence.
rev.diff:
Line 6: Line 6:
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killers]], including murderers [[Ed Gein]], [[Richard Chase]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill Jerry Lynn Dean. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind.
Necrophilia has also been a motive for some [[serial killers]], including murderers [[Ed Gein]], [[Richard Chase]], and [[Jeffrey Dahmer]], who ate his victims after killing them. Several other [[murder]]ers have described drawing sexual excitement from killing, as well, such as [[Karla Faye Tucker]], who claimed to have an [[orgasm]] with each swing of the [[axe]] she used to kill Jerry Lynn Dean. The guilty-plea testimony provided by the recently captured ([[2005]]) serial killer [[Dennis Rader]] provided a rare public glimpse into the workings of such a controlling mind.
â   â
In some cases, necrophiliacs work in the [[funeral]] business, presumably to facilitate access to [[human]] corpses. (See also "Pop culture", below).
 
== Consensuality issue ==
